intro: Hapalochilus caudipetalus, commonly known as the long-petaled rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of its branches. Its leaves are leathery and evergreen, adapted to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. Hapalochilus caudipetalus is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it tolerates harsh environmental conditions.
